metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10156 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was discovered in the way Ansible templating was implemented in versions before 2.6.18, 2.7.12 and 2.8.2, causing the possibility of information disclosure through unexpected variable substitution. By taking advantage of unintended variable substitution the content of any variable may be disclosed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.5.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
